svt_gpio_configuration Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_gpio_configuration:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Configuration descriptor for the DUT reset and General-Purpose I/O VIP.

  function svt_pattern
 svt_gpio_configuration::do_allocate_pattern
 (   ) 

HDL Support: This method allocates a pattern containing svt_pattern_data instances for all of the primitive data fields in the object. The svt_pattern_data :: name is set to the corresponding field name, the svt_pattern_data :: value is set to 0.

Return values - An svt_pattern instance containing entries for all of the data fields.

Member Attribute Documentation

 svt_gpio_data_t  attribute
 svt_gpio_configuration::enable_GPi_interrupt_on_fall = 0

Report an "interrupt" when the corresponding bit on the 'iGPi' input signal falls. Can be combined with enable_GPi_interrupt_on_rise to report an interrupt on change. The default value is 0 (no interrupt enabled).

 svt_gpio_data_t  attribute
 svt_gpio_configuration::enable_GPi_interrupt_on_rise = 0

Report an "interrupt" when the corresponding bit on the 'iGPi' input signal rises The default value is 0 (no interrupt enabled).

 rand int unsigned  attribute
 svt_gpio_configuration::min_iclk_dut_reset = 10

Minimum duration of the reset assertion, in number of iClk cycles The default value is 10 clock cycles.

 rand int unsigned  attribute
 svt_gpio_configuration::min_iclk_reset_to_reset = 1

Minimum number of iClk cycles before the DUT reset can be re-asserted. The default value is 1 clock cycle.

 svt_gpio_vif  attribute
 svt_gpio_configuration::vif

Virtual interface to use for a VIP. Valid only if 'hw_xtor_cfg' is null.
